result.execSummary:
The defendant Charissa C Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
--On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 1 year jail with Huber  and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years.

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

miscConds.notes:
--Payment of all court-ordered obligations and supervision fees.

--payment of costs, fees and surcharges
--Not be in possession of any firearms or other weapons.
--Have no contact with any Walmart store

--Submission of a DNA sample.

--Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of Corrections.

--Obtain GED

Arresting Agency: Jefferson PD

6/11/19: Court Orders JOC be amended to reflect 1 year probation on Count #2.
Concurrent with: concurrent to the sentence in Count #1 and any other sentence in being

records.addlTxt: Criminal Case Settlement

[ma] Case called at 10:37 AM 
Defendant Charissa C Williams in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing arguments given by ADA Teuber
The Court makes inquiries of ADA Teuber
Parties confirm that Ms. Williams entered pleas to both counts (ADA Teuber had made reference to Count #2 being read in and dismissed--- it was NOT)
ADA Teuber provides the Court with Criminal Case Settlement form 

Sentencing arguments given by Attorney Luchsinger 
Statement made by Ms. Williams

ADA Teuber verifies victim rights compliance

On Count #1, the Court IMPOSES & STAYS 1 year jail with Huber  and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years.
On Count #2, the Court withholds sentence, and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, concurrent to the sentence in Count #1 and any other sentence in being. 

Conditions of Probation: 
--Submission of a DNA sample.
--Payment of all court-ordered obligations and supervision fees.
--Complete all programming as deemed appropriate by the COMPAS assessment and the Department of
Corrections.
--Not be in possession of any firearms or other weapons.
--Maintain employment and/or school.
--Obtain GED
--Have no contact with any Walmart store
--payment of costs, fees and surcharges

Days credit for time already served: 3  days

Attorney Luchsinger requests that cash bond be returned to surety, and that payment of all costs, fees, and surcharges be a condition of Ms. Williams probation
--ADA Teuber makes objection, makes record

The Court grants Attorney Luchsinger's request, bond is to be returned to surety. 
recess: 11:15am
cc: Da (electronically), Attorney Luchsinger (electronically)
Letter from DOC
Sentencing hearing on January 4, 2019 at 10:30 am.
with Elements attached

[MA]Case called at 10:50am 
Defendant Charissa C Williams in court with Attorney Steven John Luchsinger.  Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " GUILTY " entered on Counts #1 and #2; factual basis stipulated.  The Court accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

Attorney Luchsinger requests that a Presentence Investigation be conducted
--no objection from ADA Beck

The Court orders a complete Presentence Investigation be conducted 

recess:11:01am 
NEXT: Sentencing on 1/4/19 at 10:30am
Jury trial on October 22, 2018 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on October 18, 2018 at 10:30 am.

(SF) Case called at 2:20 pm
Defendant Charissa C Williams not in court, Attorney Steven Luchsinger appears in court.  DA Susan Victoria Happ appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Luchsinger has no explanation for the defendant's non-appearance.
Court reviews procedural posture of the case.

DA Happ requests a warrant be issued
Attorney Luchsinger inquires if there are any returned mail in the file.
Clerk advises that there is no returned mail in the file.
Court issues a bench warrant.
recess: 2:21 pm
reconvene: 2:32 pm
Defendant Charissa Williams now appears in person, with Attorney Steven Luchsinger. DA Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.

Court quashes warrant.
Attorney Luchsinger advises that there is no resolution and requests a jury trial date be set.

recess: 2:35 pm
NEXT: (1) FSSC on 10/18/18 at 10:30 am (2) Jury Trial on 10/22/18 at 8:30 am

[MA]Case called at 1:23pm
Defendant Charissa C Williams appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Luchsinger.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Court reviews the Court Record
Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $250 CASH Bond, with conditions:
-No contact with Shontae Martin Cole or Kenneth Greene  
(*Direct or indirect contact prohibitions include but are not limited to phone calls, letters, emails, texts, social media, other electronic means and no one can contact the person on your behalf except an attorney.) 
-No presence at any Wal-Mart Store

Ms. Williams gives updated address and phone number
recess 1:31  pm.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Steve Luchsinger
Extradition Forecast

Reserve Judge Davis presiding for Branch IV: 
[MK] case called at 2:12pm. 
Defendant Charissa C Williams not in court.  Her counsel, Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger appears in court. ADA Theresa Beck appears for the State of Wisconsin.
This case is scheduled for Preliminary Hearing today. 
ADA Beck reports that her office learned that Ms. Williams was released from Ellsworth Correctional Institution on approximately February 23-25th.  
ADA Beck motions for the issuance of a warrant, however Attorney Luchsinger indicates that he has telephone contact information for Ms. WIlliams, so he requests that the Court allow him time to reach Ms. Williams. 
The Court orders a warrant, but stays its execution until 3/17/16 to allow time for Attorney Luchsinger to arrange for her to appear voluntarily.  
recess 2:16pm.

Preliminary hearing at 03-11-2016 01:45 pm
